lesson.title_and_level: Upper-Intermediate - To Love or Be Loved

sentence.idiomatic: How can you only think of yourself? That is so selfish.
He is a very selfish person. He always saves the good stuff for himself.
People should not be too selfish, otherwise when you are in a difficult situation others will not help you.
These past few years I have put forth a lot, but he doesn't care a bit.
You should get something back for what you put in, it's only fair!
No matter how big the cost, I want to succeed.
Doing good deeds doesn't need reciprocation.
My parents went to great lengths to raise me. I definitely need to repay them properly.
The investment for this project is low, but the returns are high. I think it's feasible.
I think that true love is more precious than a jewel.
You are the most precious gift God has given me.
Those precious historical artifacts have all been preserved in the national museum.
People often only treasure something once it's already lost. Unfortunately it's already too late.
Once true love has been found it must be cherished.
Only now have I discovered how precious time is. Before I didn't understand it was something to be cherished.
He always saves the letters you write him. It's obvious that he really loves you.
How can you not even know this program? It's obvious you don't watch much TV.
There are footprints all over the floor. You can see that someone has been here.
Traveling during the Golden Week is complete torture; there are people everywhere.
He doesn't shut up. Going out to eat is sheer torture.
Loving and being loved are equally torturous.
We are old friends, what are we doing haggling over such a small amount of money?
He is a very big-hearted person, he will rarely haggle over gains or losses.
I don't want to split hairs over past things. What's important is the present.
Isn't poking yourself with a needle painful? Aren't you abusing yourself?
I'm not as much of a masochist as you, wearing a skirt in such cold weather.
You are a real masochist. You have so much money yet live in such a small, dilapidated place. You have no concept of enjoyment.
Do you think finding someone to love or having someone love you is more important?
Of course it is having someone love you. Loving someone else is too hard!
You are too self centered. If you don't love them, you call that love?
Of course love is selfish. Moreover, I'm not saying you shouldn't love, it's a matter of how much you love. Love typically means that the more you put in, the less you get out.

But when you come across true love, putting effort into it brings a kind of happiness. I wholeheartedly put all my emotions into love. Although I've been hurt before, having experienced love is a very precious thing.
But I feel that the more you love somebody, the more they take you for granted.

How can you make such a blanket statement? I believe that provided you truly love someone, they also will love you. However I think sometimes that lovers look for someone they love, but when people get married they look for someone that loves them. This is the only way to be content and happy.
Look at you, you are just the same as me. You see, it's better to be loved.
But certainly first find true love once. Love is the most beautiful feeling in the world. Is it really possible that you have never been in love before?
Of course i have been in love. So I understand the pain of loving someone. You are always wondering whether the other person loves you, desires you, as much. In short, loves bites!
If you make those kinds of comparisons, it's not true love. True love is unselfish. It is not about who puts forth more or less. Enjoying the feeling of love is the most important.
Ah! You are really a sucker for punishment.
